channel.title: Deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help
channel.description:
deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help how do i change this
http://img838.imageshack.us/img838/5254/fdssdf.png
to my name?

item.title: Deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help
item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar
item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

[quote=“hack3r, post:15, topic:498339”]To change the login message, simply open up “loginmessages.java”
You will then see my name, and a few others, you can make a new method, then announce it in the initialization…

But, if your not a “pro” at java then you can just search for “hack3r” and replace it with your name, then edit the text/shad/col to whatever you want

Have fun! :d[/quote]

Anyway I can private you?

Read full topic

item.title: Deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help
item.dc:creator: @hack3r hack3r
item.description:
@hack3r wrote:

To change the login message, simply open up “loginmessages.java”
You will then see my name, and a few others, you can make a new method, then announce it in the initialization…

But, if your not a “pro” at java then you can just search for “hack3r” and replace it with your name, then edit the text/shad/col to whatever you want

Have fun! :d

Read full topic

item.title: Deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help

item.description:
@Mr.czar wrote:

[quote=“3lv3n snip3r, post:13, topic:498339”]For the yell, it’d be in your Commands class. Just add a new string in your Config class with your username. Then, just use the variable you just made as playerName variable instead of doing this:

It’d be:

That way, instead of changing every name, possibly in multiple classes, you’d only need to change one.[/quote]

Deathlypvpz is a PI source.

item.title: Deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

For the yell, it’d be in your Commands class. Just add a new string in your Config class with your username. Then, just use the variable you just made as playerName variable instead of doing this:

It’d be:

That way, instead of changing every name, possibly in multiple classes, you’d only need to change one.

item.dc:creator: @Mr.czar Mr.czar

@Mr.czar wrote:

It’s in the file “requesthelp.java” on the source not the client.

Search for

You will see the names hack3r and hack3rdice there. Change them to what you want.

item.title: Deathlypvpz... simple one i guess thanks for help
item.dc:creator: @ggson ggson
item.description:
@ggson wrote:

Actually it is not client sided as a matter of a fact, it is source sided. Go into your source folder and search for ‘config’, and it should be a java file NOT class. Then scroll down or press ctrl F and search for those names. and you should be able to find it and search for it. Then all you have to do from there is change it to what you want, save it and compile, then there… problem solved

Read full topic
